column4: i'd like to install nvidia-96 (I have an mx440) but there is a blocking package I don't recognize
so, the package doesn't exist? -> I can't have nvidia-96 because it depends on non-existent packages?
Do you have the restricted repo enabled?
how do I check for restricted repos
You normally just install "nvidia-current" to get NVidia stuff running.
Specific versions may depend on stuff that's already missing...
but how do I check for the restricted repo?
Never mind. I have the same issue, I have all the repos enabled. Seems your only option is to contact the repo mantainers.
Maybe you can just get the driver off nvidia.com somehow?
No, it's the Ubuntu repo mantainers' fault in this case.
NVidia are far better than AMD, trust me.
Wine only has official repos for fairly old Ubuntu versions, wine is in the official Ubuntu archives now.
